poem:
Title: "The Dance of the Insured"

Against the surety of solid stone,
The clock's play bids my patience thin.
Ten winters I have thrown the bone,
And with a gambler's trust, did win.

The game is done, the die is cast,
No call to barter, they decree,
While inflation's shadow tall and vast,
Looms o'er my once-secured decree.

By Axa's hand, the cost mounts high,
The dance of insured turns bitter dry.
